me.albrt.serialport

Class SerialPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.albrt.serialport.SerialPort

  • public final class SerialPort
extends java.lang.Object
    Project: serialport Author: Albert Lloveras (@albert_lloveras) Date: 30/06/2017. Description: SerialPort main class responsible for identifying the operating system type and the processor architecture to decide, if compatible, which native driver should be loaded. It also acts as a bridge between the C/C++ native code and the portable cross-platform JAVA code of the library.

      • SerialPort

        public SerialPort()

    • Method Detail

      • getPortList

        public java.lang.String[] getPortList()
        Gets the full list of available serial ports on the current machine.
        Returns:
        Returns a list containing the name of all available serial ports on the current machine.

      • getAvailableBaudRates

        public int[] getAvailableBaudRates()
        Gets the full list of available baudrates supported by the operating system on the current machine.
        Returns:
        Returns a list containing integer values that correspond to the different baudrates available on the current machine.

      • openPort

        public void openPort(java.lang.String port,
                     int baudrate)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Configures the received port at the received baudrate and opens it to start a serial communication.
        Parameters:
        port - The name of the port to configure and open. This name must exist on the list of available ports.
        baudrate - The desired baudrate for the selected port. This value must be present on the list of available baudrates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception will be raised when an unexpected error occurs during the process of configuring or opening the port. Usually exceptions are raised due to a lack of permissions to use the selected ports or becuase the port is already in use by another process in the system.

      • closePort

        public void closePort()
        Closes the port that has been previously opened by the same instance of this class. If any port has been already opened, a call to this method won't do anything.

      • writeByte

        public void writeByte(byte b)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs a synchronous write on the transmission line of the serial port that has been previously opened by the same instance of the SerialPort class.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte that has to be written to the serial line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception will be raised if the instance of the class doesn't have any port open or an unexpected error occurs during the write operation.

      • readByte

        public byte readByte(int timeout)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs a synchronous read on the reception line of the serial port that has been previously opened by the same instance of the SerialPort class. This method will block the calling thread until a new byte is received or the timeout period is elapsed.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the call will block if no byte is available on the reception line of the serial port.
        Returns:
        If a byte has been received the byte value will be returned. Otherwise, when timeout period is elapsed, null value will be returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception will be raised if the current instance of the SerialPort class doesn't have any port open or an unexpected error occurs while receiving a new byte.

      • readByte

        public byte readByte()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs a synchronous read on the reception line of the serial port that has been previously opened by the same instance of the SerialPort class. This method will block the calling thread until a new byte is received.
        Returns:
        The received byte value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception will be raised if the current instance of the SerialPort class doesn't have any port open or an unexpected error occurs while receiving a new byte.
